pullRequest.body:
Co-authored-by: John Talbot j.talbot@ucl.ac.uk

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [a0eac52db8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21268/commits/a0eac52db8d803c6b8a853e97bbdf77a37c5a7a8)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ degree_le_of_le`
`+ minDegree_le_minDegree`
`+ minDegree_of_isEmpty`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

You missed a few suggestions, I indicated which ones. Here are some tips about the review process.
When getting through a review, please make sure you considered all the remarks. If you applied a suggestion, you can resolve the conversation to indicate it's done. If you did not apply one, please explain why and leave the conversation unresolved so that I can see your comment right away. It is important to make sure that you addressed all the comments, otherwise it just makes the review process longer. If you are okay with a code suggestion, you can hit the "Commit suggestion" button to automatically apply it (make sure to sync your local branch if you do that).
Don't forget to remove the awaiting-author label when you are done, and resolve a conversation if you applied all the suggestions in it.
Thanks for all your help! I think I've gone through everything. Sorry about the previous commits, I should have been a bit more careful.

This seems all right to me, thanks!
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by EtienneC30.

Thank you! And thanks Etienne for the excellent and detailed review.

bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13360443971/job/37309268293)

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13362099260/job/37313404026)

bors r-
bors d+

:v: lian-tattersall can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Canceled.

Thanks! While this PR was going through the review process, I've renamed `WithTop.untop'` to `WithTop.untopD` to match other Lean 4 names. I've merged `master` and applied a 1-character fix that should make the CI happy. If it works, then please `bors merge` it.

Thanks! :tada:
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13363809623/job/37317759861)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13363809623/job/37317759994)
No problem! It takes some time to get used to the review process. Here are two more small comments.

Thank you for your work! My remarks are mostly about style conventions, with a few shortcuts in proofs. Don't hesitate to ask if you have any questions, and don't forget to remove the awaiting-author label when you're done.
Two small comments
No problem! It takes some time to get used to the review process. Here are two more small comments.

The variable `H` and the `Fintype` are only used in the lemma below so you can put them inside the statement. Also note that `:` must always be surrounded by whitespaces.
```suggestion
variable {G v} {H : SimpleGraph V} [Fintype (H.neighborSet v)]
```

Please skip a line before the docstring and add a full stop at the end. Also note that when writing code or mathematical expressions in a docstring we put it inside backticks for a better display in the docs.
```suggestion
/-- If `G ≤ H` then `d_G(v) ≤ d_H(v)` for any vertex `v`. -/
```
You forgot backticks around `v` at the end and the full stop.

```suggestion
lemma degree_le_of_le (hle : G ≤ H) : G.degree v ≤ H.degree v := by
```

You can also use `simp_rw` here, which seems more idiomatic to me as you really are rewriting.
```suggestion
  simp_rw [← card_neighborSet_eq_degree]
```

When `apply` closes the goal it's nicer to write `exact`. Also whenever you write `by exact` you can remove it because `by` opens tactic mode and `exact` shuts it down.
```suggestion
  exact Set.card_le_card fun v hv  => hle hv
```

```suggestion
/-- If there are no vertices then the `minDegree` is zero. -/
```
You forgot the full stop here.

I'd suggest another name here, such as `minDegree_eq_zero_of_isEmpty` or shorter `minDegree_of_isEmpty`, to indicate the key hypothesis. Also note the spacing around `:=`.
```suggestion
lemma minDegree_eq_zero [DecidableRel G.Adj] [IsEmpty V] : G.minDegree = 0 := by
```
You forgot the spacing around `:=`.

```suggestion
  rw [minDegree, WithTop.untop'_eq_self_iff]
```

The `right` is not needed.
```suggestion
  simp
```

```suggestion
/-- If `G` is a subgraph of `H` then `δ(G) ≤ δ(H)`. -/
```
Can you add the white space after `/--` and before the "If" please?

You can add this to make `G` implicit only in this statement, just like `H` is.
```suggestion
variable {G} in
/--If G is a subgraph of H then δ(G) ≤ δ(H) -/
lemma minDegree_le_minDegree {H : SimpleGraph V} [DecidableRel G.Adj] [DecidableRel H.Adj]
```

```suggestion
    (hle : G ≤ H) : G.minDegree ≤ H.minDegree := by
```

Please avoid semicolons inside proofs. We only use it sometimes for very short arguments in side goals. Also note that it is used to write many instructions on one line, so first one here is useless. Finally, you can put the `intro` inside the `apply` (which can/should be turned into an `exact`) as follows (don't hesitate to ask if you don't understand what's going on here):
```suggestion
  · apply le_minDegree_of_forall_le_degree
    exact fun v ↦ (G.minDegree_le_degree v).trans (G.degree_le_of_le hle)
```
Thanks for your review. I've applied all the suggestions.

```suggestion
  exact Set.card_le_card fun v hv => hle hv
```
You use the notation `δ` here but it does not seem to be used anywhere else in the file, so it might be not clear what you are talking about. Can you maybe rephrase it to avoid the notation please?
Can you also change the `d_G` notation please? It is not used elsewhere too.

When you write `... in` it's better to stick it to the statement to make it clear it is only about that statement.
```suggestion
variable {G} in
/-- If `G` is a subgraph of `H` then `G.minDegree ≤ H.minDegree`. -/
```

```suggestion
  rw [minDegree, WithTop.untopD_eq_self_iff]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(SimpleGraph/Finite): add degree_le_of_le minDegree_eq_zero and minDegree_le_minDegree
